title: 2014 6 Hours of Spa-Francorchamps
text:
The 2014 WEC 6 Hours of Spa-Francorchamps, formally known as the WEC 6 Heures de Spa-Francorchamps, was an <a href="endurance%20racing%20%28motorsport%29">endurance</a> <a href="sports%20car%20racing">sports car racing event</a> held at the <a href="Circuit%20de%20Spa-Francorchamps">Circuit de Spa-Francorchamps</a>, <a href="Spa%2C%20Belgium">Spa, Belgium</a> on 2–3 May 2014. Spa-Francorchamps served as the second race of the <a href="2014%20FIA%20World%20Endurance%20Championship%20season">2014 FIA World Endurance Championship</a>. <a href="Toyota">Toyota</a>'s <a href="Anthony%20Davidson">Anthony Davidson</a>, <a href="S%C3%A9bastien%20Buemi">Sébastien Buemi</a>, and <a href="Nicolas%20Lapierre">Nicolas Lapierre</a> led the field to the checkered flag for their second consecutive victory of the season, ahead of <a href="Audi">Audi</a> and the sister Toyota. The LMP2 category also had its second consecutive winner with <a href="OAK%20Racing">G-Drive Racing</a> ahead of <a href="Simon%20Dolan">Jota Sport</a>'s guest entry in the series. <a href="AF%20Corse">AF Corse</a> <a href="Ferrari">Ferrari</a> held off <a href="Porsche">Porsche</a> <a href="Olaf%20Manthey">Team Manthey</a> in the LMGTE Pro class, while another AF Corse Ferrari won the LMGTE Am category ahead of two <a href="Aston%20Martin">Aston Martin</a>s.

Qualifying result.
Pole position winners in each class are marked in bold.
 – The No. 37 SMP Racing Oreca-Nissan was allowed to grid at the back of the LMP field.
